article:
On 22 June 1942, the Albanian student trio of 'Branko Kadija', 'Jordan Misja'
and 'Perlat Rexhepi', who stayed in Misja's house at Firaj Street in ShkodÃ«r (at
the time part of the fascist Italian protectorate of the Albanian Kingdom), were
for several hours surrounded by Albanian quisling (fascist) forces and police,
numbering some 600 people. The three young friends were members of the Communist
Party of Albania, which was established on 8 November 1941 and had began with
smaller detachments of 5-10 people which engaged in various acts of sabotage to
the Italian forces, including antifascist propaganda in order to gain support of
the masses. Albania at war, 1939-1945 Bernd JÃ¼rgen Fischer Edition
illustrated Publisher C. Hurst & Co. Publishers, 1999 ISBN 1-85065-531-6, ISBN
978-1-85065-531-2 p. 127 After an air bombardment, Opat 1969, p. 310:
"Perlat RedÅ¾epi, Branko Kadija a Jordan Misja â v obklÃ­ÄenÃ­ oddÃ­lÅ¯m karabiniÃ©rÅ¯
a faÅ¡istickÃ© milice. DÅ¯m. ve kterÃ©m se brÃ¡nili, byl dobyt teprve po leteckÃ©m
bombardovÃ¡nÃ­." they rushed out of the house and managed to kill many of
the quisling soldiers, but were shot down and instantly killed. Pearson
2006, [http://books.google.com/books?id=P3knunC7z_oC&pg=PA198 p. 198]: "In
Shkoder three students, Perlat Rexhepi, Branko Kadia, and Jordan Misja, were
surrounded in a house by a large force of troops and police. They rushed out of
the house, killing many of the besiegers, but were shot down and died
instantly" New Albania 1971, p. 5: "The news spread
like wildfire that hundreds of fascists had surrounded painter Jordan Misja's
house on Firaj Street. Inside were Jordan and two clandestine comrades: Perlat
Rexhep and Branko Kadia. Hundreds of fascists were deployed to
..." Maksutovici 1995: "BaricadaÅ£i Ã®ntr-o casÄ, tinerii Perlat Regepi,
Branko Kadia Åi Jordan Misja au rezistat Ã®n mod eroic atacului a peste 600 de
carabinieri, agenÅ£i de poliÅ£ie Åi miliÅ£ieni fasciÅti." Frasheri 1964, p. 285 Hoxha 1984, pp. 173-
174 The three were proclaimed People's Heroes of Albania for their
act, and they are
collectively known as the 'Three Heroes of ShkodÃ«r' ().

{{cquote |A legendary epic, one of the most heroic episodes of our [Albanian]
national liberation struggle |author=Academy of Sciences of Albania on the Three
Heroes of ShkodÃ«r AKADEMIA E SHKENCAVE E RPSSH â FJALOR ENCIKLOPEDIK
SHQIPTAR, TiranÃ« 1985, p. 641 }}

Jordan Misja was a painter. Kadija and Misja belonged to
the Orthodox community of ShkodÃ«r, which at that time there were a few families,
which all belonged to the same social level. Pipa 1978,
p. 156 According to some, both Misja and Kadija were ethnic Serbs (see
